title: Which vintage guitar would you not sell even if you were given an attractive offer? - Quora

response.answer_text: My 1978 Gibson Les Paul Standard - natural finish. I bought that guitar with money I made helping my father rebuild our porch. It was probably my first ‘real’ guitar. I bought it from my friends girlfriend who didn’t like it because it was ‘too heavy’. Not only have I used it for many things since then, in 1986, a band I was working for asked Ace Frehley from Kiss to sit in with them. Ace shows up without a guitar. Not only did I spend a lot of time with him which was blast, but I let him use my guitar for 2 or 3 songs. There is an entire video of YouTube of this event titled ‘Smashed Gladys at Cat Club Ace Frehley’ - and at the end of the video, Ace takes off the guitar, and hands it to me. I still have those strings in the picture, and a note from Ace that says ‘Great guitar Chris!’. Ace was probably the guy that got me into guitar playing. Seeing that gatefold to Kiss Alive II, I knew I wanted to play in a band. I’ll never sell that thing :)
